page.title: 05MANOR FARM HOUSE RUISLIP
page.content: The Manor Farm House still exists in Ruislip and is a listed building. It has two flats on the top floor. Downstairs it has a kitchen and two meeting rooms which are regularly used by local societies. One of these is the Workers Education Association. It is also used by the Citizen's Advice Bureau.The Manor Farm Hall is in the car park. Meals on Wheels are served there. Some of the organisations who use the Manor Farm leisure complex regularly are:- the Women's groups eg W.R.U.S, T.W.G and W.I; the Political groups eg political parties, local councillor surgeries and C.N.D; the social groups eg Caledonian and Horticultural societies; Charities eg Mind, A.A. and Animal Reserve; Educational groups eg Milk Marketing Board and Gas Board.
